title: Period of SHM - block and sled on spring

content.question: A sled of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is attached to one end of a horizontal spring with spring constant <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math>, as shown. The other end of the spring is attached to a wall. The sled is free to move along a horizontal surface with negligible friction. A block of mass <math alttext="2 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></math> is placed in and secured to the sled. The sled-block system is displaced a distance <math alttext="x sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and then released. Which of the following expressions is equal to the time the sled-block system takes to travel a distance <math alttext="8 x sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="4 pi times the square root of the fraction m over k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mfrac><mi>m</mi><mi>k</mi></mfrac></msqrt></math>
<math alttext="16 pi times the square root of the fraction m over k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mfrac><mi>m</mi><mi>k</mi></mfrac></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="4 pi times the square root of the fraction 3 m over k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>m</mi></mrow><mi>k</mi></mfrac></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="16 pi times the square root of the fraction 3 m over k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>m</mi></mrow><mi>k</mi></mfrac></msqrt></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4 pi times the square root of the fraction 3 m over k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>m</mi></mrow><mi>k</mi></mfrac></msqrt></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
